alert.note: Alert for Aroostook; Penobscot; Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 27 at 6:22PM EST until February 27 at 6:45PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EST FOR SOUTHEASTERN PISCATAQUIS...SOUTHEASTERN AROOSTOOK AND NORTHWESTERN PENOBSCOT COUNTIES... At 621 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from 11 miles east of Mars Hill to 9 miles south of Scopan to near Dexter, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Near whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts greater than 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 between mile markers 243 and 303. US Highway 1 between Houlton and Mars Hill. State Highway 11 between Milo and Squapan. Locations impacted include... Presque Isle, Houlton, Millinocket, Dover-Foxcroft, Dexter, Guilford, Patten, Brownville Junction, Mount Katahdin, Milo, East Millinocket, Mars Hill, Medway, Hodgdon, Ashland, Easton, Sherman, Island Falls, Monson and Bridgewater. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Travel is not advised during this dangerous snow squall. Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to lead to accidents. Consider delaying travel until the squall passes your location. If traveling, pull off to a safe location and turn your headlights on.
